If he ever doubted that this woman was not a true warrior, the Khan 
was now corrected. He had not even seen her follow him.

However, he knew he was superior. Hundreds of years of genetic 
selection had made him a perfect warrior, and he knew he was able to 
surpass a mere machine, as deadly as it was.

He dodged two of the flame pillars coming at him but the third burned 
some armor and paint over his torso. He chose to counter with full 
force. He launched forty mini-missiles at her, but spread widely. She 
would barely be able to escape his attack. His pistols went at her 
too.
